W R Grace (Grace), Edison site has a Risk management Program which meets the requirement of OSHA-PSM,

EPA-RMP and Program 3 NJ-TCPA Risk management Program. The site is an OSHA VPP Star Site and is certified for ISO 9001 Quality Management System.

a) Accidental release prevention and emergency response policies at the stationary source.

The Edison site as of June 2006 has two occupants, Equistar Chemicals, LP, and Grace. Equistar is the site owner and operates one large process; Grace owns three of the site buildings and operates other processes. Equistar provides and manages a broad spectrum of services to Grace including Utilities, Maintenance, shipping/receiving/warehousing and Emergency Response (ER) for both companies. To the extent possible, all Emergency Response programs apply to all site operations and both Equistar and Grace are co-owners of these programs.

The accidental release prevention policy at the Edison site is documented in the "Management System" document. It includes all the required elements of RMP including maintaining Process Safety Information, Employee Participation, Process Hazard Analysis and Risk Assessment, Standard Operating Procedures, Operator Training, Pre-startup Review, Mechanical Integrity, Hot Work Permit, Management of Change,

Accident Investigation, Emergency Response, Compliance Audits, Contractors and Inherently Safe Technology review.

The Edison site strives to maintain a safe working environment, it is therefore essential that employees beable to deal effectively with emergencies that may develop during course of operations. Therefore, a multifunctional

ER team (ERT) has been formed. The site ERT shall provide the actions necessary to control an emergency with the following priorities:

1. To safeguard the lives of company personnel;

2. To protect the well being of our visitors, contractors, truck drivers, neighbors and the community;

3. To protect the environment;

4. To protect company property.

Leak detection systems are installed in process areas to detect toxic or flammable leaks.

The preventive maintenance program includes inspections and tests to assure the proper operation of preventive devices. Management of change procedure assures that all changes are reviewed for their hazards and preventive steps are implemented prior to implementation of the changes. All incidents and near misses are investigated to determine the root cause and corrective actions are implemented to prevent future incidents.

d) The five year accident history:

There have been no releases from the covered processes which meet the requirements of section 68.42 on 40 CFR 68 subpart A.

e) The emergency response program:

The site emergency response program meets the requirements of the EPA Integrated Contingency Plan Guidance. The plan defines the response organization, coordination with the local emergency response committee, equipment, response procedures, training, notification procedures and drills. The plan is updated according to the recommendations from the system deficiencies uncovered by periodic drills and incidents reports. As stated above, all Emergency Response programs apply to all site operations and both Equistar and Grace are co-owners of these programs.

f) Planned changes to improve safety:

Recently installed a second tank to be used to collect a Titanium Tetrachloride spill to reduce impact of a spill on the plant and surrounding community.



A Toxic Chemical tank truck/Iso-tainer unloading facility with containment and scrubbing system is being installed at the time of this update
